me.Abhigya.core.util.math

Interface Vector

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.bukkit.configuration.serialization.ConfigurationSerializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Vector2D, Vector3D

    public interface Vector
extends org.bukkit.configuration.serialization.ConfigurationSerializable
    Encapsulates a immutable Vector. Methods like normalize() will not modify this Vector, and a new Vector containing the result will be returned instead.

    Also values like length() are cached for a better performance.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static float FLOAT_EPSILON
      A "close to zero" float epsilon value for use

    • Field Detail

      • FLOAT_EPSILON

        static final float FLOAT_EPSILON

    • Method Detail

      • length

        float length()
        Gets the magnitude of the Vector, defined as sqrt ( x^2 + y^2 + z^2 ). The value of this method is cached, so repeatedly calling this method to get the vector's magnitude will not re-calculate it. NaN will be returned if the inner result of the sqrt() function overflows, which will be caused if the length is too long.

        This is the equivalent of using: 

        Math.sqrt ( lengthSquared() )

        Returns:
        Magnitude

      • lengthSquared

        float lengthSquared()
        Gets the magnitude of the vector squared.

        Returns:
        Magnitude

      • normalize

        Vector normalize()
        Gets the unit equivalent of this vector. ( a Vector with length of 1 ).

        Returns:
        Created unit vector from this

      • toVector2D

        Vector2D toVector2D()
        Gets the 2D equivalent of this vector.

        Returns:
        Equivalent, or the same vector if called from an instance of the same class.

      • toVector3D

        Vector3D toVector3D()
        Gets the 3D equivalent of this vector.

        Note that calling this method from Vector2D will result in an UnsupportedOperationException. The method Vector2D.toVector3D(float) must be used instead.

        Returns:
        Equivalent, or the same vector if called from an instance of the same class.

      • toBukkit

        org.bukkit.util.Vector toBukkit()
        Gets the Bukkit equivalent of this vector.

        Note that calling this method from Vector2D will result in an UnsupportedOperationException. The method Vector2D.toBukkit(double) must be used instead.

        Returns:
        The equivalent

      • toLocation

        org.bukkit.Location toLocation(org.bukkit.World world,
                               float yaw,
                               float pitch)
        Gets a Location version of this Vector.

        Note that calling this method from Vector2D will result in an UnsupportedOperationException. The method Vector2D.toLocation(World, double, float, float) must be used instead.

        Parameters:
        world - World to link the location to
        yaw - Desired yaw
        pitch - Desired pitch
        Returns:
        Location

      • toLocation

        org.bukkit.Location toLocation(org.bukkit.World world)
        Gets a Location version of this Vector with yaw and pitch being 0.

        Note that calling this method from Vector2D will result in an UnsupportedOperationException. The method Vector2D.toLocation(World, double) must be used instead.

        Parameters:
        world - World to link the location to
        Returns:
        Location
